definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: During my salad days when I was green in judgement I often blundered.
sentences.chinese: 少不更事時期，我的判斷力幼稚，常犯錯誤。

sentences.english: Whereto the judgment of my heart is tied?
sentences.chinese: 把我的心的判斷力鉤得牢牢？

sentences.english: His ad-lib comments showed poor judgment.
sentences.chinese: 他的即席評論顯得缺乏判斷力。

sentences.english: And respecting your judgment is a great place to start.
sentences.chinese: 我尊重你的判斷力，這就是個絕好的開始。

sentences.english: Keep the long-term top of mind. And bank on your own good judgment.
sentences.chinese: 應看重於長期，相信自己出色的判斷力。

sentences.english: That Brahma is bereft of sense.
They can be highly intelligent and functional, but they lack judgment” (2005, p. 59).
sentences.chinese: 他們可以有高智商並功能健全，但缺乏判斷力。

sentences.english: Judgement is measured by the decisions someone has made to-date for their startup.
sentences.chinese: 判斷力是用某人從起步開始所做的決定來衡量的。

sentences.english: I am constantly questioning my judgment and decisions.
sentences.chinese: 我一直都質疑我的判斷力和決策力。

sentences.english: Many complain of their Memory, few of their judgment.
sentences.chinese: 許多人抱怨自己記性不佳，幾乎沒人說自己判斷力差。

sentences.english: Employ simple equipment and tools to gather data and extend the senses (Standard A. 1.3).
sentences.chinese: 使用簡單器材和工具，收集數據，提高學生判斷力。

sentences.english: So it is no wonder companies are afraid. But, as so often happens, fear has clouded their judgement.
sentences.chinese: 但常見的情況是，恐懼矇蔽了他們的判斷力。

sentences.english: I really don’t feel confident enough to trust my own discretion.
sentences.chinese: 我真覺得沒有足夠的信心來相信自己的判斷力。

sentences.english: Many complain of their memory, fewer of their judgement.
sentences.chinese: 怨記憶力差的人多，恨判斷力弱的人少。

sentences.english: Judgement. Judgement is the counter-balance to wild enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 判斷力和狂野的熱情是相互平衡的。

sentences.english: Strong judgment and decisiveness; bias for action.
sentences.chinese: 較強的判斷力和決策力。

definition: ability to make one's own decisions
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
(abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
